abstract: It’s in Citigroup’s interest to fight if its ownership of Mexican bank Banamex is threatened, Breakingviews says. Even so, for Banamex, independence could offer attractions.
snippet: It’s in Citigroup’s interest to fight if its ownership of Mexican bank Banamex is threatened, Breakingviews says. Even so, for Banamex, independence could offer attractions.
lead_paragraph: Citigroup’s dismal financial state doesn’t grant its chief, Vikram Pandit, much leverage in negotiations these days, Breakingviews says.

headline.main: Should Citigroup Fight to Keep Banamex?
